handNote.p: A round Anglo-Saxon hybrid miniscule: caroline a, caroline g, but largely descending long s. f is descending and both crossing stroke and top stroke formed with a downward hook. Rounded d and eth with long ascenders curving back to the right. Pronounced wedges on ascenders, leaning almost to forking, and similarly emphatic serifs on the feet of minims. Overall slight lean to the right. No evidence of additional correcting or emending hands.
